a long narrow natural elevation or striation / a natural elevation (especially a rocky one that juts out into the sea) / a ridge of the earth's crust that has been forced upward between two faults and so is higher than the surrounding land

British general and statesman; he defeated Napoleon at Waterloo; subsequently served as Prime Minister (1769-1852) / Confederate general during the American Civil War who was defeated by Grant in the battle of Chattanooga (1817-1876) / duke of Normandy who led the Norman invasion of England and became the first Norman to be King of England; he defeated Harold II at the battle of Hastings in 1066 and introduced many Norman customs into England (1027-1087)
